docs.title: Illegitimate Humans Wiki
docs.text:
Welcome to the IllegitimateHumans Media Wiki. This site provides guides and tips for popular media platforms, including Plex.

  • Plex — media server setup and client information
  • Other platforms coming soon...

docs.title: Plex
docs.text: Plex is a media server and streaming platform that allows you to organize and stream your own media, like movies, music, and photos, on almost any device.

docs.title: Plex Clients
docs.text:
Plex clients are available on many platforms:

  • Amazon Fire TV
  • Android TV
  • Apple TV
  • Roku
  • Windows / macOS apps
  • PlayStation / Xbox
  • Web browser (Plex Web Player)

Clients can be free or require a one-time activation fee.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome! This guide will help you get started with accessing and enjoying the media content on OwlworkingLate Plex server. Plex is a fantastic platform for streaming movies, TV shows, music, and more from my personal library to your devices. Whether you're using a computer, phone, smart TV, or streaming device, it's straightforward once set up. If you run into issues, feel free to reach out.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, make sure you have:

A free Plex account. If you don't have one, sign up at plex.tv – it's quick and doesn't require a credit card. The Plex app installed on your device(s). Download options include:

Web browser: Access via app.plex.tv Mobile: Plex app from the App Store (iOS) or Google Play (Android) Smart TVs/Streaming Devices: Search for Plex in your device's app store (e.g., Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV, Android TV) Desktop: Plex Media Player for Windows/Mac

A stable internet connection. For the best experience, use Wi-Fi or a wired connection, especially for HD/4K content. An invitation from me. I'll send you an email invite or a share link to join my server.

Note: Plex works best on modern devices. If you're using an older one, check Plex's system requirements on their website.

docs.title: Accepting the Invitation
docs.text:
Check your email for an invitation from me (it'll come from Plex or my email address). Click the "Accept Invitation" link in the email. If prompted, sign in to your Plex account (or create one if you haven't). Once accepted, my server will appear in your Plex dashboard under "Libraries" or "Servers." Pro Tip: Enable "Remember Me" for easier future logins, but avoid this on shared devices.

If I shared a direct link instead of an email:

Click the link. Sign in to Plex.

docs.title: Accessing My Server
docs.text:
After signing in, look for the sidebar or menu (usually on the left). Under "Libraries," you should see sections like Movies, TV Shows, Music, etc., from my server. If you don't see my libraries:

Click your profile icon (top right) > "Authorized Devices" or "Servers" to ensure my server is listed. Refresh the app or restart it.

docs.title: Navigating the Plex Interface
docs.text:
Plex's interface is user-friendly and similar across devices:

Dashboard/Home: Shows recently added content, watchlists, and recommendations. Libraries: Browse by category (e.g., Movies, TV). Use search (magnifying glass icon) to find specific titles. Filters and Sorting: Sort by title, year, rating, or genre. Filter unwatched content. Details Page: Click a title for synopsis, cast, ratings, and playback options. Playlists and Watchlists: Create your own playlists or add items to your watchlist for later.

  • Use any Plex player to test playback.
  • Verify metadata and artwork.

docs.title: Mobile Apps
docs.text:
Mobile apps (iOS/Android) may require a small activation fee.

  • Supports offline downloads.
  • Can stream content from home or remote servers.
  • Works with multi-user accounts if Plex Pass is enabled.

docs.title: Server Setup
docs.text:
Best practices for hosting Plex Media Server:

  • Use wired connections for reliability.
  • Store media in widely supported formats (MP4/H.264, AAC).
  • Keep your server software up-to-date.
  • Consider a dedicated machine for large libraries.

docs.title: Tips and Troubleshooting
docs.text:
-Buffering Issues: Lower the quality in settings, check your internet speed (Plex recommends 5Mbps+ for HD), or restart your router/app. -Can't Find Server: Ensure I've shared the library with you specifically. Double-check your email for the invite. -Device Limits: I might have set limits on simultaneous streams – if it's busy, try again later. -Subtitles Not Working: Some content might not have them; I can add if requested. -Updates: Keep your Plex app updated for the best performance. -Security: Never share your Plex login with others. If you forget your password, reset it via plex.tv. -Common Errors:

-"Server Unavailable": My server might be offline – I'll restart it if needed. -"Unauthorized": Re-accept the invite or contact me to re-share.

-If something's not working, provide details like your device, what you're trying to do, and any error messages. Enjoy the content, and happy streaming!

docs.title: Transcoding
docs.text: Transcoding converts media on the server for client compatibility.

docs.title: When Transcoding Occurs
docs.text:
• Unsupported codecs or resolutions
  • Limited bandwidth
  • Client device restrictions
